result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlon N Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs shall be paid from cash bond on file with any balance due to be paid at the rate of $20/month commencing June 15, 2015 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Court imposes fine of $642 to be paid from cash bond on file w/balance due at the rate of $20/mo comm 6-15-15 or judgment shall enter.    Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
